meanings.definition: The act of expressing disapproval or finding fault.
meanings.sent1: Her criticisms of the movie were harsh.
meanings.sent2: Constructive criticisms can help us improve.
meanings.sent3: His criticisms of the cake were so funny.
meanings.sent4: The criticisms of her painting cut deep.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's criticisms were always fair.

meanings.definition: The analysis and judgment of the merits and faults of a literary or artistic work.
meanings.sent1: The criticisms of the book were detailed.
meanings.sent2: Literary criticisms can offer valuable insights.
meanings.sent3: Their criticisms of the play were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The criticisms of the sculpture were like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: Her criticisms of the poem were insightful.

meanings.definition: The act of making negative comments or judgments.
meanings.sent1: His criticisms of the new policy were unwarranted.
meanings.sent2: Public criticisms can sometimes be hurtful.
meanings.sent3: The criticisms of his outfit were hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The criticisms of her speech were like arrows.
meanings.sent5: Constructive criticisms are more helpful than destructive ones.
